website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3 has a flexible lens in a compact body and produces reliably good automatic-shooting results.
cons: AVCHD Lite video and 14-megapixel resolution seem unnecessary
no controls for aperture or shutter speed

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love it and it's really easy to use. I had determined that my next point and shoot would record in HD and working at indoor soccer arena the results have been stunning. Uploading the videos of game to Youtube has produced videos that look sharp and the camera does well to keep up when auto focusing resulting in less blur. Generous viewfinder. Only drawbacks would be the microphone is located at the top of the camera which leads me to covering it a lot and the resulting muffled audio is disappointing. Also the battery is proprietary so either buy an extra or be sure to have it charged before going out.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford

customer_reviews.title: wonderful camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to take photos of my grandson and to take photos of mountain scenery. I am happier with my purchase than I even imagined I would be. The parts that are important to me: 1) I can set it to not use flash so it doesn't bother my grandson, 2) I can set it on automatic, and it handles everything, 3) I can take great videos that include adorable little baby sounds as well as capturing his activities, 4) It takes good telephoto and wide angle photos of mountains, wildflowers, etc. I'm really, really happy I got this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Rose

customer_reviews.title: Very good pictures but...
customer_reviews.text: I love love loved this little camera and it served me well for almost three years. Then it got dust on the sensor. So I learned from YouTube how to take it apart and remove the dust. I congratulated myself on being so handy. Three months later, dust on the sensor again. Fixed it again. Three months later, dust on the sensor again. Groan. I replaced it with a different digital pocket camera from Panasonic. I loved it a lot but it had a fatal flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Scott DeMoss

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Photo Quality
customer_reviews.text: I did a great deal of research and finally settled on this camera for Christmas last year. I just don't enjoy taking photos any more. We have low light in our house, and the quality of pictures is poor. The photos are often blurry. I find the settings confusing and the instructions limited. The videos will play on my camaera, but not my computer. I have researched that, but am unable to find a solution. Last week I purchased an IPhone 4s and am hoping to just get rid of my camera completely. I would stay away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: S and K Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Still being used and like it
customer_reviews.text: Still using this camera as of 11/21/2013, and still working great. However, it's been eclipsed by newer models (the XS20 that we've since bought) but if you want a good quality camera for a beginner or someone who doesn't need a whole bunch of bells and whistles, this one's for you. I take it with me when riding my motorcycle, which I probably wouldn't want to do with the pricier new one - I don't mind if it gets scratched sliding past the zipper of my jacket pockets
customer_reviews.author: bascar

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this purchase! I did my research & found a camera that had everything I wanted (and then some). Got a great price through Amazon! Great little camera; has all the features a novice could possibly need and plenty of options for seasoned photogs as well. In fact, this camera does SO much, I haven't even had a chance to really study all that it can do to take advantage of all the features! Love the MP's, optical zoom, large LCD screen, easy navigation and size. Also like having the ability to zoom while taking a video.
customer_reviews.author: Doozi

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been to several countries with me over the last 2 years and most pictures taken have been just what I had expected when I pressed the button. When I bought it, it was as good as was available at that time. In fact it was so good that I could easily skip a couple of generations of this camera. But now the ZS20 is out and everything is further improved: Zoom, speed, low light performance, and new features I didn't even dream about when the ZR3 came out. Testet a few other cameras but came back to Panasonic once again.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: pleased with camera
customer_reviews.text: So good I now own two. Very sharp pictures and easy to use. Video is nice but acvhd mode required separate program on Mac to convert. I have been using Borosoft conversion software. You don't have to use acvhd as there is another mode for video. It may be that Imovie 11 will read acvhd so check. Anyway, i have gotten also some fairly good macro shots but it takes some playing around to get that right as focusing is sometimes hit or miss. For family pictures inside or outside, this is a superior camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera for it's size and extreme zoom capability.
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera but had to return it due to problems. This was purchased as an open box, so I can't complain about the camera itself. I have a large format camera and this was purchased (due to the price) as a glove box camera for emergencies. Nice pictures until Zoomed to the max, where flaws could be seen. As I stated, this was an open box so I can't comment on a "new" item.
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Moreland

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice camera. Very good quality images
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice camera. Very good quality images. We've had it now for a few years but I find that we just don't really use it that much. I am spoiled by the camera in my Galaxy S4 phone. However this camera is very compact and has a very good zoom range and very light weight. It actually is easy to place into a small pouch that could clip to you belt or I would imagine could easily fit into a handbag.
customer_reviews.author: Bob F.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic digital camera!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Panasonic Lumix digital camera for 1-1/2 years now & I like it so much that when my-son-the-lawyer kinda shocked me by mentioning that he didn't currently have a digital camera, I sent this one to him in Hawaii (where he lives & works). I mean if you live in HI you need a great camera, right? So now he has one! He LOVES the Lumix DMC-ZR3, he raves about it every time he calls home. And he better start sending me pics of Hawaian sunsets, etc. really really soon!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: lakshmiluvsvishnu

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I ever had
customer_reviews.text: This camera is extremely good. I've had it over 2 years now and its still great. I recently bought an underwater case for it and now I can record when I go diving. Can't find anything bad to say about this camera. Zooms while recording excellent video and still quality good stabilization easy to use functions small light very fast startup. I use a 16GB Class 6 card. Get it!!
customer_reviews.author: davidbec

customer_reviews.title: Easy "Learning Curve"
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera to replace my Kodak EasyShare, which I was happy with except for "closeups". Being 60+, the "learning curve" was intimidating, but once I set aside time to actually read how to use it, it turned out to be very easy. I am very happy with this purchase. It will be the last camera I ever buy...does everything I need it to do. Maybe I'll tackle that iPhone thing next...
customer_reviews.author: ljmason

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well and is durable. Quality of the video is superb and software to view and edit the mts and/or mov files it produces is available online for free. Using a class 6, 32GB SD memory card and it works flawlessly. My only complaint is that in lower light settings the pictures are not as good as the video; they seem too dark. But that is when using the camera on full auto mode; I'm sure a real photo buff can alter some of the settings and make low lighting shots as good as the video. Other than that a great camera for the money that I highly recommend. Long battery life too.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Very poor picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Maybe we were unlucky and got a dud, but since the first day we used this camera the pictures were all washed out. It wasn't until we had some pictures to compare to over the holidays that we realized just how terrible they were. All of our pictures are very washed out and have very little detail. I am not a novice camera user, but an avid photographer. This was to be my small camera and I didn't expect much from it but I did at least expect reasonably clear pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Team Davis

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: After some research and consultation and having been in the photo industry all my life, I decided on the Panasonic DMC ZR3 as my choice for a new digital camera. Based on what I learned before my purchase, I've not been disappointed in the least. This is a wonderful camera, very user-friendly and it takes incredible pictures and videos. I've already recommended it to friends who have also shown an interest in getting a new camera. I can also recommend 17th Street Camera as the seller. I've known that in the past, some New York mail-order houses had a reputation for not fulfilling their promises, selling "Gray-Market-Goods", etc. But 17th came through with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: GeeTee

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to replace an older Olympus point and shoot digital camera after doing extensive research and looking at several different brands of digital cameras. I wanted more zoom power and this little camera delivers on that. Also, the wide angle lens makes beautiful pictures of large areas. It is very easy to use with easy to read buttons and settings. I wanted a large view screen (3" or larger), but this 2.7" screen works fine, and my pictures that I have made so far have beautiful color and clarity with the AUTO setting. I recommend this camera for any photography novice who doesn't want to fool with a lot of settings. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Redtag

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix MC-ZR3 camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera. I purchased it from Amazon Warehouse and the description read that the camera would have blemishes on the front and/or top. There are none. The camera is in perfect condition. Pictures are good. I have a large Canon camera which has more tricks included but I am taking his camera hiking, canoeing, etc., and it's the perfect size. I've read that people complain that the control buttons are small, but this is a small camera so you have to expect that. The features on this camera are quite intuitive. Overall, a nifty pocket size camera to haul along wherever you go.
customer_reviews.author: maple leaves

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to use camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easy to use point and shoot camera with good picture quality and video. This camera does the job and then some. It is the best digital camera I have ever owned. The picture quality is great and the HD video is even better. With a mini HDMI to normal HDMI cable you can plug this camera right into most HD sets with ease. I have a 60 inch Sharp and everything looks flawless from the camera. I haven't even tapped into all of the features and I am very, very satisifed. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants to shoot quick, quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Good friend & amazing photographer,Dwytt Dayan,when i asked why he had two Lumix cameras & what should i get? He told me"Lumix got Leica lenses!need I say more?!!"Well he did say more! I took his advice & got the ZR3. I've been away from photography since before the digital takeover. I'm pleased! Leica lens is still as sharp as the film shooting days!Sharp images,even at 16x enlargement. Ease of operation is good,most functions can be learned without the manual.Size is quite portable,just a bit thicker than a cell phone,Nice screen size,2/3 the size of the camera.Good motion pictures,good sound!Good price.nice.
customer_reviews.author: mikel

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix
customer_reviews.text: The Lumix DMC-ZR3 is a very good camera. I especially like the AI setting which is great for a quick point and shoot pictures of the grand kids. The pictures are easily downloaded to my computer using the supplied USB cable. Overall I'm very pleased with the Lumix ZR3, it takes a great picture and is easy to operate. This a must for my wife, there is no setup or lens adjustments for light or distance. This is my second Lumix camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had an eye piece for viewer
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to see what I am taking a picture of if the sun is shining brightly on the LCD screen.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Same black spot problem after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: This has been mentioned in a few reviews now, so I would say this is a serious flaw in this camera. We noticed the black spots appearing after about 18 months, now 4-5 months later the camera is pretty much unusable and we are looking to buy a new one. Not great after less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ivan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Good camera for great price
customer_reviews.text: Been playing with it for a couple of hours today. I must say it takes wonderful pictures and captures lots of details in a shot. Lots of things to play with in the settings and must say the 8x optical zoom is pretty nice. If you're looking to capture shots at the full 14.1 mp quality, I would recommend at the minimum a 4g SDHC Memory card. But if you can afford it go ahead and get the 8 gb SDHC memory card because 14.1 megapixel shots are going to take up lots of space.
customer_reviews.author: Two Cool

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great value
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this camera. Great picture and video quality, zoom is pretty nice, I love the little dial so I can quickly switch between video, intellegent auto, and pre-sets. The view screen is nice and big. Drawback: shutter speed is still slow.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 13 year old daughter for Christmas and she absolutely loves it. It is small and easy to use and takes better pictures than her old Kodak. She has been running around trying all of the various features and has been ecstatic about the results. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Taw

customer_reviews.title: Great features, low-light issues
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this camera about a month, but I was surprised how poor the indoor pictures were while using the Intelligent Auto focus. I've played with some of the camera settings and manually improved some things, but this is a step I didn't have to take with my last Canon. That being said, its portability and video taking I love. The video does not suffer from the same low-light issues as the still shots. For the money, this camera offers a ton. I just wish it peformed better indoors, where most of my pictures are taken this time of year.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Best little camera ever
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera. It was easy to use and carry and took great pictures. My 2yr old took it in his baby pool with him and when I tried to replace it I was sad to learn it no longer exists.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barbaro

customer_reviews.title: A Step Above Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: We were in the market for a new camera but didn't think we were quite ready for an SLR. This seemed to be somewhere in between an SLR and point and shoot and the price was right, so we got it. We decided on this one because of the 720 video and haven't been disappointed. The only thing a little weird about the video is the default format which didn't play well with the computer. However, you can change it to a PC friendly format and now life is good. The actual pictures are great as well and the 14mp leaves a lot of definition in case you want to do some cropping.
customer_reviews.author: TheoDoor

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The camera took decent pictures. However, it lasted just over a year before breaking down. The lens started to retract awkwardly when I turned it off. Eventually, it stopped retracting altogether. I used a fully charged battery, but it still could not bring it back to life.
customer_reviews.author: Ugly Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Lumix because a previous model had been lost/stolen. I was sad to lose my previous Lumix, but feel the incident ended up being a blessing in desguise because I LOVE this newer model! There are more pixels for added sharpness in the photos, increased user-friendliness in the multiple of settings (including a movie button all by itself), and the ability to zoom in and out during movie recording. GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Ltram

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera a lot. It is very compact so it is easy to bring with me and it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: KristenTag

customer_reviews.title: Wise choice
customer_reviews.text: Camera is great for all types of photography, The Leica optics are just as good as the Carl Zeiss optics on Sony cameras. Video is very high quality and allows zooming during filming which is a good feature that's missing from many compact cameras available today. I would suggest every new owner to read the operating manual in case they are not happy with the intelligent mode, because the manual mode options are all new and need some explanation. for $200 its an awesome deal!
customer_reviews.author: A. Hussein

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image
customer_reviews.text: It takes great pictures & I use 90MB/s SDHC memory cards.
customer_reviews.author: M. Towles

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic LUMIX Camera
customer_reviews.text: Good camera, except for night photography and real close-ups. Pictures with flash aren't as bright as you want them. Good lens, lightweight. Overall very happy after three years of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: works very well
customer_reviews.text: Haven't found any Cons to this one yet. Very good for the price, just got back from a snowmobile trip where it was below zero and it worked great outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Meline

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It broke really soon, on/off button did not work in some months.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth cabrel s

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for chasing around a kid.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take snapshots of my toddler and it's great! Small enough to take anywhere, and takes great pics and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Slacking off

customer_reviews.title: small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I haven 't used it that much, but what I have done has been terrific. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: L.S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Anazing little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a pocket camera. I'm a professional Photographer and hate lugging around my SLR's all the time. This camera performs great in daylight! As good as my SLR's! Low light?...come on...there are very few cameras that do well in low light...kinda like your own eyes! No light...no see! But for general snapshots of friends and scenics...its absolutely amazing! Very pleased...and it fits in my pocket so nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Joeywankanobe

customer_reviews.title: First impressions: impressive video quality, poor low light photos
customer_reviews.text: I received this camera three days ago, and this is my first impressions: Pros: 1- The video recording is awesome, even in low light 2- Outdoor photos are very nice and the colors are great 3- the optical zoom is good 4- the design of the camera very good Cons: 1- Very very poor image quality in low light, so if you want this camera for indoor shots i'd advise you to stay away, because i bought it for indoor usage and i'm disappointed now. 2- Very limited options in intelligent mode (iA) 3- Bad flash light I'll update this review after few days.
customer_reviews.author: valy

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This by far is the best camera that I have ever owned, and to make it even better, it is a very pretty shade of blue. It's easy to use and takes great pictures. There is an option on it to taker video, it's not the greatest quality video, but it will get the job done. I love the fact that it has a rechargeable battery, so I'm not adding to battery waste. I would definitely suggest this camera to anyone I know looking for a a new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: zr3 review by RF4CPLT
customer_reviews.text: good buy for the money at 150ish. Seems durable, takes decent pics (for great pics I have a Nikon SLR) and it is the right size to fit in your pocket. 8x zoom provides good zoom capability with camera in your hand (good stabilization). More than 8x zoom would require a tripod for virtually any camera. Color is decent too. I recommend this camera based on my limited use so far.
customer_reviews.author: RF4 PILOT

customer_reviews.title: Great amera.
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this camera. We have owned it for about 2 weeks but we have taken over 200 pictures on it. It takes good action shots and good low light shots. The pictures are clear and sharp. The camera is easy to use and I like how all the buttons work. The zoom works very well and I love the 10x zoom. The stabilization works well with the zoom all the way out as well. Videos seem to work well too. I was a little apprehensive to buy a Panasonic because I have always had Kodak and assumed Canon and Nikon were better, but I am glad I chose the Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T. Dietz

customer_reviews.title: camera review
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new-comer to the digital world, so can't compare to others. My kids tell me it's a great buy. (I'm a "senior.") I'm still learning how to use the various options; but so far I like it very much. The zoom is great for my wild-life and other long distance photos. It's so small I can carry it everywhere - tuck it in a pocket or in my purse. I'd recommend it to other new-comers.
customer_reviews.author: Clare in Milford

customer_reviews.title: Great photos and it fits in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: Got a NIKON Coolpix for Christmas and the lens cover broke after 3 uses so I retuned it and got the Lumix to replace it. I get amazing photos even at long range. (this mini camera has an 8X optical zoom and 10X digital zoom. After dozens of uses, the automatic lens cover still works perfectly. A great buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Fields Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good IQ on well lit situations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera due to the good reviews. It takes good pictures only on well lit situations. Forget indoor use. The IQ is just unacceptable. I had an older lumix before and that camera is five times better than this one especially in low light situations.. or hardly any light at all.
customer_reviews.author: intellectually_stupid

customer_reviews.title: Best fit
customer_reviews.text: We just had our first child and the camera we had was slow and many of the pictures were blurry. All of my friends wanted me to get a SLR camera but I wanted something small I could carry around in my pocket for those special moments that just pop up. I spent time reading reviews on a lot of sites, especially Cnet.com and Amazon.com. This camera was the best fit for my needs and had all the features I wanted and none of the fancy stuff I didn't. It takes great pictures, we are totally satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Researcher

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy to use and great resolution. Only hitch, battery must be removed to be recharged but it is easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: Yorky

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMC-ZR3 digital camera
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic DMC-ZR3 takes excellent photos both inside and outside. The incredible zoom brings the action up close and viewable. The controls are logical and easy to use. The internal menus make sense and can be found quickly every time. This camera is just the right size and easy to hang on to, even with one hand. There is minimal shutter delay which plagues lots of other camera brands. Panasonic did a nice job designing this small but powerful camera.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Fournier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the Panasonic Lumix because it's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Tumbles

customer_reviews.title: camera rating
customer_reviews.text: It is the perfect compact camera. It takes amazing pictures and we just love it. Terrific. You ask to much. shouldn't have to count words for comments.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Steber Stanek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i liked it at first, but don1 use it as often since i have an i;pad and iphone.
customer_reviews.author: madeline johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera that works well in fully automatic mode or using manual settings. Very fast response time makes it easy to get the pictures I want to get. Easy to use and even fun to use. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mopar Seven

customer_reviews.title: Need  a little patients
customer_reviews.text: To begin with the low light photos are in fact horrible but you can reduce the exposure and have a great shot. I shot a few pics in bright sun light but colours were washed out so I increased exposure again great shots so I strongly suggest adjusting exposure even though (point & shoot) auto should be worry free as every thing in life needs a little adjusting.The feel of the ZR3 is compact switches and toggles secure I would have liked the to exchange the selection wheel with the shutter but I've already gotten used to it .The video @avchd is crisp looks great on the PC I do recommend the zr3
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Worst camera that we've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Every picture is bury. Using the auto or manual settings have no effect. Almost every picture is also over exposed. Received the camera a week after purchase. After a week of frustration and testing, we discovered that we can not return this terrible camera due to a 14 day return policy. Our old 5mp Olympus out performs this 14mp camera in every way. May take a sledgehammer to it do to the frustration of wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Didn't need to read all instructions to use in automatic mode. Good quality pictures. Have used video function once ... also very easy and good results with great sound from quite a distance. Very small and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Cowlady

customer_reviews.title: Need advice with camera operations.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this camera as a gift. I like the quality of the pictures and movies, but I am not a digital genius. Does anyone know of a good book or dvd that will help me learn to use all the features? The manual that came with my camera is not helpful to me.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Novice

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera with awesome HD video quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera almost 6 months back and pretty happy with the purchase. Small in size, fits in pocket but does not compromise on quality. The iAuto (intelligent Auto) mode works great for still pictures. I did not experiment with other modes as iAuto worked for me in all situations so far. I was looking for a camera with good HD video quality and found this one. I don't have to maintain a camera and camcorder as this has both the features. I bought a 16gb card and that is enough for hours of video.
customer_reviews.author: Maheswar Vayugandla

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to take pictures during a cruise vacation and I am so pleased with the quality of the pictures. It is simple to use and the small size made it easy to take everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: N. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Weak flash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera with much excitement. I had a older version of the panasonic lumix, that I just absolutely loved. I very seldom had a bad picture, and if I did, it was my fault. With this camera, the flash is too weak. Subjects just 2 feet away in medium light with the flash will come out dark. So, so disappointed. I just got this camera in December, and I am now looking for a new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: intuitive
customer_reviews.text: I had less than a week to familiarize myself with this camera before a trip to the Galapagos. I had no trouble using the IA setting and just shooting. Great photos from a trip of a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: bigguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is amazing. This is my second Lumix and I am sold. The pictures are crisp, colorful and it's ease of use is commendable. The sport setting captured water drops at the seashore, the sunset setting captured amazing sunsets in Maine. It is small enough for your pocket but powerful enough for even the best of photographers that want ease of use. The zoom is more than adequate and image stabilization works fine.
customer_reviews.author: lkg14830

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: this camera has exceeded my expectations. I was back and forth on several different cameras, but landed on this one in the end. very pleased at picture quality. it also takes very good pictures of moving targets. the night time setting is more than acceptable, although not perfect. battery life is descent as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Legit point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: Pretty strong little camera for the cost. I've compared this particular camera with rivals from Nikkon, Cannon, etc, and was more than impressed with the final product. Camera takes fantastic pictures in low-light and fast motion settings, which is more than can be said for some of its competitors. Picture quality is incredible. Display and functions are easy to use. Might just be the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: MRC

customer_reviews.title: nice buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, my wife and kids are all pleased with this purchase! Easy to operate, adequate speed, and enough photo options for most occasions....we'd recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: dinky5

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera, nice features, easy to use interface. Panoramic view function has some minor issues. Camera has only 2 interface languages (english and spanish).
customer_reviews.author: mss

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: The video quality is that of an expensive, professional video camera. I have 2 other digital cameras, one a Sony and one a Cannon. None of them have the quality of my Panasonic. Can't wait to take it on vacation with us, I can imagine all the pictures and videos I'll take. I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Buffolino

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my wife's first digital camera. It was a hit (which wasn't easy). It is quality, easy to use and shoots great pictures and video. I'll probably get one for me too!
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Groot

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3
customer_reviews.text: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3 is an amazing camera. I love it. It is probably the best digital camera I have every used. It is very expensive so it's even better. When I tell people how much I paid they can't believe it. I would hightly recommend this camera. The picture quality is phenomenal and the battery has a long life.
customer_reviews.author: Yasser Khalil

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with photo quality, but not durability
customer_reviews.text: Takes great photos for a point and shoot. Impressed with both outdoor and indoor photos. Red eye reduction is excellent. Camera durability is just okay. It is very lightweight, which may be a bonus to some people, but it almost seems too light/fragile. The lens cover is very delicate. I think dropping this camera once might damage or break it for good. I haven't had to worry about this as much with other cameras I've owned. This one I really need to be careful with. However, I would still recommend this camera for photo and video quality and other available features. It is very nice and I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: An amazing Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an anamazing camera given its size. It does what I wanted: I can put it in my pocket and get fairly decent photos. Screen glare is a problem outside in bright sun.
customer_reviews.author: Henry C. Englund

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves the red panasonic camera. It was easy for her to use and the big screen helps her see what the picture will look like.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for bucks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bang for your bucks! Workmanship is good; Leica lens are great. Did have to purchase a carrying case and memory card. Overall, a good product for the average consumer. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Delcambre

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumic DMC-ZR3
customer_reviews.text: The best compact camera I've ever owned.Took perfect pictures and never had a bad one.Really recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Yusri B. Muhamad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pictures!
customer_reviews.text: OMG the pictures are amazing! many options to use and have special and different pictures form the things you love or want to remember
customer_reviews.author: Tats98

customer_reviews.title: Lumix ZR3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use for a combination of personal/vacation and business (technical writing) documentation. So far, it has taken excellent pictures in both situations. The Intelligent Auto mode works well, and with the variety of pre-set Scene modes, there's some amount of control. Probably not enough for a photo-pro who would want to tailor every setting, but it works well for grab-and-shoot, plus some planned shots. The zoom is great, also.
customer_reviews.author: serious skills

customer_reviews.title: panasonic dmc-zr3
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for the price, the pictures are beautiful and the settings for the camera are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: S Falls Teske

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality pics
customer_reviews.text: The price can't be beat for all of the features packed into this camera. Unfortunately, the features don't leave you with high quality pictures. As others have said - great pics in high light outdoor situations, but very poor results in anything else. I can't recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: No as good I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I am a pro photographer who bought this camera because of the wide angle Leica lens which most point and shoots do not have. There is a long lag time between exposures which means you cannot capture anything in quickly. You have to wait several seconds between exposures. It also does not take good photos in low light situations-photos come out blurry even when you make an effort to stay still. Sharpness is also an issue-lens does not live up to the Leica name. My Canon Elf performs much better than this camera. Disappointed in the Panasonic's overall performance and I would not recommend buying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Flamingo

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR3 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Red)
product_meta.description:
Color:RedFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Panasonic's Lumix DMC-ZR3 digital camera features powerful zoom within a remarkably slim and compact body. Newly added is an AVCHD Lite movie recording function to make the versatile camera even truly "hybrid". 

The new image processing technology "Intelligent Resolution" is incorporated in the Venus Engine HD II for ZR3. By detecting the signals whether they are at edges of the subject, they compose detailed texture or just a soft gradation first and give appropriate enhancement to the edges and textured areas respectively. Unlike the uniform enhancement of sharpness, it is possible to perform the optimum signal processing to give a whole image outstandingly natural clearness with fine detail. 

This technology is integrated in iA (Intelligent Auto) mode--a hallmark of Lumix cameras--working thoroughly while the camera is in the iA mode to enhance its potential in many aspects. The iA mode is also available in movie mode. It automatically selects the most suitable Scene mode and helps to correct handshake, focus and brightness problems--making the iA mode your one-stop solution to capture beautiful photos and movies. 



The powerful 8x optical zoom lens makes it easy to pull in subjects from far away a step closer compared to the conventional stylish point-and-shoot cameras. For an added boost, zoom power can be increased to 10x with the Intelligent Zoom function taking advantage of the Intelligent Resolution technology maintaining the picture quality even combining a digital zoom. The 25mm ultra wide-angle feature is ideal for both broad landscapes and tight indoor shots, letting photographers capture a wider view. The 14.1-megapixel high resolution CCD reproduce the detailed images corner to corner and affordable with trimming or even more powerful Extra Optical Zoom by using the center part of it. 

Notably the Sonic Speed AF in the ZR3 features its speed at the industry's fastest level. Combined with a high-speed start-up, this gives the ZR3 an ultra fast response that helps to catch even the most fleeting photo opportunities. The 2.7-inch large Intelligent LCD offers dynamic and clear view out of its small body. The battery life is also as powerful as approx. 330 pictures shooting thanks to the highly energy efficient image processing LSI, the Venus Engine HD II. 

With high-quality aluminum texture which resists fingerprints and soiling, the slim, compact, pocket-fitting size of ZR3 is packed with a host of functions for both photos and movies to be an ideal partner for traveling or for everyday snapshots. 

Lumix DMC-ZR3 Highlights 

25mm Ultra Wide-angle Lens
The 25mm ultra wide-angle lens* has about twice the shooting area as a standard 35mm lens. This enhances all kinds of shooting situations, like when you're photographing a group of people at an indoor party or shooting a large structure or sweeping landscape while traveling.
* Converted to standard 35mm camera equivalent, at the maximum wide position. 

10x Intelligent Zoom/16.9x Extra Optical Zoom
Thanks to the newly incorporated Intelligent Resolution technology, the Intelligent Zoom is available with the DMC-ZR3 which extends the zoom ratio by approx. 1.3x maintaining the picture quality even combining a digital zoom. This means the 8x optical can virtually extend to 10x equivalent. Furthermore, the Extra Optical Zoom function that extends zoom power to 16.9x* by using the center part of the large CCD to bring subjects even closer.
*At 3-megapixel resolution or less. 


HD Movie in AVCHD Lite
In addition to Motion JPEG images, the DMC-ZR3 can record high-definition motion images in AVCHD Lite. It features almost double the recording time in HD quality compared with the conventional Motion JPEG format. 

Powerful 8x Optical Zoom
The DMC-ZR3 also lets you use zooming when taking motion pictures. Its powerful 8x optical zoom is ideal for capturing dynamic video clips of sports action or animals in nature. 


High Quality Sound
The DMC-ZR3 features Dolby Digital Creator to record high quality audio, so you can match the beautiful movies with outstanding sound. 

POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer) Shake Detection
Just about everyone has had the experience of taking a photo at night and hoping to capture all the memories and beauty, only to be disappointed at the poor result. The POWER O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer)* nearly doubles the hand-shake correction power of conventional MEGA O.I.S. You get bright photos without blurring even from handheld shooting at slow shutter speeds. Panasonic's accumulated optical technologies, the MEGA O.I.S. has been incorporated into Lumix from the early stage of digital camera development. This helped show all digital camera users the absolute need for hand-shake compensation, and led to its prevalence throughout the industry. And now, Panasonic has worked on the low-frequency vibration hand-shake component, which is physically generated when pressing the shutter button or when shooting at night with a slow shutter speed.
*The POWER O.I.S. is automatically turned on in the iA Mode and can be turned on or off in the Normal Picture Mode or some Scene Modes.
